Docker Compose Health Check

By Chris Dearnley
November 16, 2024
#docker #docker-compose #health-check #devops

A simple health check configuration for Docker Compose services

Hereâ€™s a handy Docker Compose health check configuration that I use frequently:

version: '3.8'

services:
  web:
    image: nginx:alpine
    ports:
      - "80:80"
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD", "wget", "--no-verbose", "--tries=1", "--spider", "http://localhost/"]
      interval: 30s
      timeout: 10s
      retries: 3
      start_period: 40s
    depends_on:
      api:
        condition: service_healthy

  api:
    image: node:18-alpine
    ports:
      - "3000:3000"
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD", "wget", "--no-verbose", "--tries=1", "--spider", "http://localhost:3000/health"]
      interval: 30s
      timeout: 10s
      retries: 3
      start_period: 40s

Key Points

  • interval: How often to run the health check
  • timeout: How long to wait for a response
  • retries: Number of consecutive failures before marking as unhealthy
  • start_period: Grace period before health checks start
  • depends_on: condition: service_healthy: Wait for dependencies to be healthy

This ensures services start in the right order and are actually ready before dependent services try to connect.
